application.name: getkey
application.brief: Outputs the value of a requested keyword
application.description: This program will output the value of a requested keyword. Its general use is within batch jobs, perl programs, or other scripting languages. It allows the script writer to easily obtain values from cube labels or other label-like files such as those output by programs like stats, percent, etc.

history.change: Modified schema location from astogeology... to isis.astrogeology..."
Change parameter from GROUP to GRPNAME because of conflicts in the print and history files (keyword named GROUP in a GROUP). Added OBJNAME and UPPER parameters.
Added KEYINDEX param and fixed bug with list keywords. Also modified to output to the UI session log rather than the terminal window if the UI is open.
Fixed bug that did not allow you to get a keyword that was not in a group or object and reworked code to avoid the repetition of code
Added helper button to the FROM parameter to output the file.
Changed preferences to not output to terminal, and added results group to session log.
Made UPPER equal to FALSE by default

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: The file specification containing the input label.

helper.name: H1
helper.description: This helper button will display the input file in the log area

parameter.name: OBJNAME
parameter.brief: Object name containing the group or keyword
parameter.description: Enter the name of the Object which contains the group or keyword. If the keyword is not in an Object then ignore this parameter. The name is case insensitive.

parameter.name: GRPNAME
parameter.description: Enter the name of the Group which contains the keyword.

parameter.name: KEYWORD
parameter.description: Enter the name of the keyword.

parameter.name: KEYINDEX
parameter.description: If the keyword is a list, you may enter an integer value for the index of the keyword value you would like to retrieve. The default is 'All' and will return the entire list of keyword values.

parameter.name: UPPER
parameter.description: If set this parameter causes all character output to be in uppercase.

parameter.name: RECURSIVE
parameter.description: If set it will search recursively, however if an object name is specified it will recursively search for that object and then recursively search inside only that object.
